Show / Hide Table of Contents

Namespace Polite.RuntimeServices

Classes

Container

The default class within the Polite framework that defines object members, and a storage location, which a Variable may point to.

Frame

Used as a base-class for all layers of a Stack.

Function

The class that represents a function's raw definition. Not to be confused with FunctionInvoker or MethodInvoker.

FunctionInvoker

Wrapper class for Function for the interpretation process.

JavaScriptRuntime

Defines the Runtime to interpret and operate on simplified Grammars.JavaScript syntax.

MethodInvoker

Wrapper for the Function class to help with internal method calls.

RefContainer

The default class that defines an internal reference to an System.Object for things like member access and indexers.

Runtime

The PCR (Polite Common Runtime) used for caching and executing instructions in any Polite language.

Runtime.OperationFactory

The master class that creates an Runtime.Operation from a defined expression.

Runtime.OperationFactory.Assignments

The static class defining all ways in which the Polite Framework lets you to assign variables.

Runtime.OperationFactory.Assignments.RefAll

Runtime.OperationFactory.Assignments.RefNone

Runtime.OperationFactory.Assignments.RefObject

Runtime.OperationFactory.Assignments.RefValue

RuntimeSettings

Defines Runtime settings as used in the interpretion process.

RuntimeSettings.ObjectTypes

Defines the passage and assignment of object-types.

RuntimeSettings.ValueTypes

Defines the passage and assignment of value-types.

Stack

The class that handles stack memory within the Runtime.

Variable

The class that is used to represent a variable at Runtime.

Delegates

Initializer

The process by which a particular Variable is initialized at Runtime.

Runtime.Operation

Defines an operation that always returns an internal value (that is, not a Polite Variable but rather a .NET System.Object), except in the case of assignments.
